explanation: Agent A is correct. In the provided configuration mhd_assert(...) is defined as ((void)0), so every mhd_assert invocation in-line in the XDLL_* macros becomes an executed no-op expression-statement. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), those no-op assertion statements are dead code: they execute but have no effect and removing them would not change program behaviour. Note the relevant points: the assertion arguments are not evaluated (the macro expansion omits them), the remaining ((void)0) statements are executed but do nothing, and that satisfies the rule’s definition of dead code. To address the issue you can remove assertion calls entirely in the production build (i.e. avoid leaving a no-op statement in the macro expansion), or conditionally compile the assertion calls out so that no executed no-op remains at the call site.
